keel.Algorithms.Associative_Classification.ClassifierCMAR

Class AssocRuleMining

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • keel.Algorithms.Associative_Classification.ClassifierCMAR.AssocRuleMining
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RuleList, TotalSupportTree

    public class AssocRuleMining
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Set of utilities to support various Association Rule Mining (ARM) algorithms included in the LUCS-KDD suite of ARM programs.
    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Frans Coenen 2 July 2003, Modified by Jesus Alcala (University of Granada) 09/02/2010, Modified by Sergio Almecija (University of Granada) 23/05/2010
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double confidence
      Command line argument for % confidence (default = 50%).
      protected int[][] conversionArray
      2-D array used to renumber coulmns for input data in terms of frequency of single attributes (reordering will enhance performance for some ARM algorithms).
      protected short[][] dataArray
      2-D aray to hold input data from data file.
      protected boolean errorFlag
      Error flag used when checking command line aruments (default = true).
      protected java.io.BufferedReader fileInput
      The input stream.
      protected java.lang.String fileName
      Command line argument for data file name.
      protected java.io.File filePath
      The file path
      protected boolean inputFormatOkFlag
      Input format OK flag( default = true).
      protected double minSupport
      Minimum support value in terms of number of rows.
      protected int numClasses
      Number of classes in input data set (input by the user).
      protected int numCols
      Command line argument for number of columns.
      protected int numOneItemSets
      The number of one itemsets (singletons).
      protected int numRows
      Command line argument for number of rows.
      protected short[] reconversionArray
      1-D array used to reconvert input data column numbers to their original numbering where the input data has been ordered to enhance computational efficienvy.
      protected double support
      Command line argument for % support (default = 1%).

      • inputDataSet

        public void inputDataSet(myDataset train,
                         DataBase dataBase)
        Commences process of getting inout data (GUI version also exists).
        Parameters:
        train - myDataset Class where examples are stored to build the classifier
        dataBase - DataBase Class to store the examples to work with the algorithm and some other useful information

      • readFile

        public void readFile(myDataset train,
                     DataBase dataBase)
        Reads input data from file specified in command line argument (GUI version also exists).

        Proceeds as follows:

        1. Gets number of lines in file, checking format of each line (space seperated integers), if incorrectly formatted line found inputFormatOkFlag set to flase.
        2. Diminsions input array.
        3. Reads data
        Parameters:
        train - myDataset Class where examples are stored to build the classifier
        dataBase - DataBase Class to store the examples to work with the algorithm and some other useful information

      • binConversion

        protected short[] binConversion(java.util.StringTokenizer dataLine,
                                int numberOfTokens)
        Produce an item set (array of elements) from input line.
        Parameters:
        dataLine - row from the input data file
        numberOfTokens - number of items in row
        Returns:
        1-D array of short integers representing attributes in input row

      • idInputDataOrdering

        public void idInputDataOrdering(DataBase dataBase)
        Reorders input data according to frequency of single attributes.

        Example, giben the data set: 

            1 2 5
    1 2 3
    2 4 5
    1 2 5
    2 3 5
        This would produce a countArray (ignore index 0): 
            +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 3 | 5 | 2 | 1 | 4 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
        Which sorts to: 
            +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 2 | 5 | 1 | 3 | 4 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 5 | 4 | 3 | 2 | 1 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
        Giving rise to the conversion Array of the form (no index 0): 
            +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 3 | 1 | 4 | 5 | 2 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 3 | 5 | 2 | 1 | 4 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
        Note that the second row here are the counts which no longer play a role in the conversion exercise. Thus to the new column number for column 1 is column 3 (i.e. the first vale at index 1). The reconversion array of the form: 
            +---+---+---+---+---+---+
    |   | 2 | 5 | 1 | 3 | 4 |
    +---+---+---+---+---+---+
        Parameters:
        dataBase - DataBase Class to store the examples to work with the algorithm and some other useful information

      • countSingles

        protected int[][] countSingles(DataBase dataBase)
        Counts number of occurances of each single attribute in the input data.
        Parameters:
        dataBase - object where the examples to work with the algorithm and some other useful information are stored.
        Returns:
        2-D array where first row represents column numbers and second row represents support counts.

      • orderFirstNofCountArray

        protected void orderFirstNofCountArray(int[][] countArray,
                                       int endIndex)
        Bubble sorts first N elements in count array produced by countSingles method so that array is ordered according to frequency of single items.

        Used when ordering classification input data.

        Parameters:
        countArray - The 2-D array returned by the countSingles method.
        endIndex - the index of the Nth element.

      • defConvertArrays

        protected void defConvertArrays(int[][] countArray)
        Defines conversion and reconversion arrays.
        Parameters:
        countArray - The 2-D array sorted by the orderCountArray method.

      • recastInputData

        public void recastInputData()
        Recasts the contents of the data array so that each record is ordered according to conversion array.

        Proceed as follows: 1) For each record in the data array. Create an empty new itemSet array. 2) Place into this array attribute/column numbers that coorospond to the appropriate equivalents contained in the conversion array. 3) Reorder this itemSet and return into the data array.

      • recastInputDataAndPruneUnsupportedAtts

        public void recastInputDataAndPruneUnsupportedAtts()
        Recasts the contents of the data array so that each record is ordered according to ColumnCounts array and excludes non-supported elements.

        Proceed as follows: 1) For each record in the data array. Create an empty new itemSet array. 2) Place into this array any column numbers in record that are supported at the index contained in the conversion array. 3) Assign new itemSet back into to data array

      • getNumSupOneItemSets

        protected int getNumSupOneItemSets()
        Gets number of supported single item sets (note this is not necessarily the same as the number of columns/attributes in the input set).
        Returns:
        Number of supported 1-item stes

      • resizeInputData

        public void resizeInputData(double percentage)
        Recasts the input data sets so that only N percent is used.
        Parameters:
        percentage - the percentage of the current input data that is to form the new input data set (number between 0 and 100).

        Returns:
        the shortened item set

      • realloc4

        protected short[] realloc4(short[] oldItemSet,
                           short[] array2)
        Resize given array so that its length is decreased by size of second array (which is expected to be a leading subset of the first) and remove second array.
        Parameters:
        oldItemSet - The first item set.
        array2 - The leading subset of the oldItemSet.
        Returns:
        Revised item set with leading subset removed.

                                       int n)
        Removes the first n elements/attributes from the given item set.
        Parameters:
        oldItemSet - the given item set.
        n - the number of leading elements to be removed.
        Returns:
        Revised item set with first n elements removed.

      • complement

        protected short[] complement(short[] itemSet1,
                             short[] itemSet2)
        Returns complement of first itemset with respect to second itemset.
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first given item set.
        itemSet2 - the second given item set.
        Returns:
        complement if itemSet1 in itemSet2.

      • sortItemSet

        protected void sortItemSet(short[] itemSet)
        Sorts an unordered item set.
        Parameters:
        itemSet - the given item set.

      • checkItemSets

        protected int checkItemSets(short[] itemSet1,
                            short[] itemSet2)
        Determines relationship between two item sets (same, parent, before, child or after).
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first item set.
        itemSet2 - the second item set to be compared with first.
        Returns:
        1 = same, 2 = itemSet2 is parent of itemSet1, 3 = itemSet2 lexicographically before itemSet1, 4 = itemSet2 is child of itemSet1, and 5 = itemSet2 lexicographically after itemSet1.

      • isEqual

        protected boolean isEqual(short[] itemSet1,
                          short[] itemSet2)
        Checks whether two item sets are the same.
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first item set.
        itemSet2 - the second item set to be compared with first.
        Returns:
        true if itemSet1 is equal to itemSet2, and false otherwise.

      • isBefore

        public static boolean isBefore(short[] itemSet1,
                               short[] itemSet2)
        Checks whether one item set is lexicographically before a second item set.
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first item set.
        itemSet2 - the second item set to be compared with first.
        Returns:
        true if itemSet1 is less than or equal (before) itemSet2 and false otherwise. Note that before here is not numerical but lexical, i.e. {1,2} is before {2}

      • isSubset

        protected boolean isSubset(short[] itemSet1,
                           short[] itemSet2)
        Checks whether one item set is subset of a second item set.
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first item set.
        itemSet2 - the second item set to be compared with first.
        Returns:
        true if itemSet1 is a subset of itemSet2, and false otherwise.

      • notMemberOf

        protected boolean notMemberOf(short number,
                              short[] itemSet)
        Checks whether a particular element/attribute identified by a column number is not a member of the given item set.
        Parameters:
        number - the attribute identifier (column number).
        itemSet - the given item set.
        Returns:
        true if first argument is not a member of itemSet, and false otherwise

      • checkForLeadingSubString

        protected short[] checkForLeadingSubString(short[] itemSet1,
                                           short[] itemSet2)
        Checks whether two itemSets share a leading substring.
        Parameters:
        itemSet1 - the first item set.
        itemSet2 - the second item set to be compared with first.
        Returns:
        the substring if a shared leading substring exists, and null otherwise.

      • combinations

        protected short[][] combinations(short[] inputSet)
        Invokes combinations method to calculate all possible combinations of a given item set.

        For example given the item set [1,2,3] this will result in the combinations[[1],[2],[3],[1,2],[1,3],[2,3],[1,2,3]].

        Parameters:
        inputSet - the given item set.
        Returns:
        array of arrays representing all possible combinations (may be null if bo combinations).

      • copyItemSet

        protected short[] copyItemSet(short[] itemSet)
        Makes a copy of a given itemSet.
        Parameters:
        itemSet - the given item set.
        Returns:
        copy of given item set.

        itemSets - the given set of item sets.
        Returns:
        copy of given set of item sets.

      • outputDataArray

        public void outputDataArray()

        Used for diagnostic purposes.

        Parameters:

      • outputItemSetWithReconversion

        protected void outputItemSetWithReconversion(short[] itemSet)

        Parameters:
        itemSet - the given item set.

      • outputDataArraySize

        public void outputDataArraySize()
        Ouputs size (number of records and number of elements) of stored input data set read from input data file.

      • outputConversionArrays

        public void outputConversionArrays()
        Outputs conversion array (used to renumber coulmns for input data in terms of frequency of single attributes --- reordering will enhance performance for some ARM algorithms).

                              double number2)

        Parameters:

        number2 - second given number.
        Returns:
